page.title: 11Tilstock Church.
page.content: It was erected in 1835,costing Â£2,000 the Countess of Bridgewater providing most of the money.It is a plain structure built of bricks made locally ,the church consists of nave,chancel, and side aisles,the body of the church will accomodate 303 people with a further 100 in the gallery.There is a small tower on the south side containing a clock and bell.It is one of the few churches in the country that faces south.The register dates back to the year 1836,the stained glass east windows were presented to the church in 1857 by John Lee of Whitchurch.The window frames were made in the foundries at Ironbridge.The central aisle and chancel together with a new oak pulpit,choir stalls and reading desk were provided in 1898 at the cost of Â£355.
